intro: Tapeinosperma acutangulum, commonly known as the sharp-angled tapeinosperma, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of plants, many of which are shrubs or herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with four petals. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
